intro: Thesium cruciatum, commonly known as the cross-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, cross-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands and pine flatwoods. Thesium cruciatum is an important component of the wetland ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
